tool.name: Unique
tool.command: ( export LC_ALL=C; #if int($header) > 0: sed -u '${header}'q && #end if sort -u $ignore_case $is_numeric -t ' ' #if $adv_opts.adv_opts_selector == "advanced": -k$adv_opts.column_start,$adv_opts.column_end #end if ) < '$infile' > '$outfile'

param.name: infile
param.label: File to scan for unique values

param.name: ignore_case
param.label: Ignore differences in case when comparing

param.name: is_numeric
param.label: Compare numeric values at start of records
param.help: This will try to detect numeric values at the start of each record and base comparisons only on these numbers (or the empty string if no starting number is found) (-n).

param.name: header
param.label: Number of header lines
param.help: These will be ignored during sort.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**Syntax**
This tool returns all unique lines using the 'sort -u' command. It can be used with unsorted files. If you need additional options, like grouping or counting your unique results, please use the 'Unique lines from sorted file' tool.
-----
.. class:: infomark
The input file needs to be tab separated. Please convert your file if necessary.
-----
**Example**
- Input file::
chr1 10 100 gene1 chr1 105 200 gene2 chr1 10 100 gene1 chr2 10 100 gene4 chr2 1000 1900 gene5 chr3 15 1656 gene6 chr2 10 100 gene4
- Unique lines will result in::
chr1 10 100 gene1 chr1 105 200 gene2 chr2 10 100 gene4 chr2 1000 1900 gene5 chr3 15 1656 gene6
